text: hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to
my cupcake addiction you guys have been
requesting some simple birthday cake
ideas so on today's episode I'm gonna be
showing you how to decorate a really
simple and really generic birthday cake
so this can be used for any age any
gender really any occasion at all I hope
you like what I came up with let's get
started so today which is straight
decorating the cake we're not gonna bake
it and we're not going to build it and
I'm actually starting off with a premade
crumb coated cake it's actually a
rainbow checkerboard cake that I showed
you how to make not so long ago for this
guy you're gonna need an offset spatula
a straw a ruler a pair of scissors and a
ziploc bag I've also got an assortment
of sprinkles and candies so I'm using
confetti sprinkles today and then for my
candies I've got marshmallows mini M&Ms
I've got some liquorice allsorts and
just a little red jaffas if you have
them grab like a different kind of
sprinkle and I've also got a miniature
ice-cream cone a couple of small rainbow
lollipops and I've got some of our
perfectly pipeable buttercream frosting
which I will link to the recipe for down
below as I said I'm starting with a
crumb coated cake here so if you want to
see how I made this particular cake and
got the crumb coat I can link to that
video down below but I've basically
frozen it for about 15 minutes so it's
nice and firm and now I'm just going to
take a generous amount of buttercream
frosting and I'm gonna spatula it on
once I've got a nice amount on top of
that crumb coat I'm going to use a ruler
to scrape back that first coat of
frosting and just drag the ruler around
at once they get your offset spatula and
fill in any spots so you can see your
frosting levels a little bit low you
might need to do this two or three times
but what you'll end up with is a
beautiful smooth side walled which is
the perfect foundation for any cake once
you're happy with the edges take your
offset spatula and just make sure it's
clean and sort of drag that little
Richie bit of frosting from the top back
into the top layer here so you can see
them being really gentle and I'm wiping
my spatula in between so it's always
really nice and clean I'm a little bit
of a perfectionist so even when I got to
this stage I added a bit more frosting
and smoothed it back again but it's
completely up to you how fussy you want
to be here and today's decoration
technique
leaves a little room for error so when
you're happy with the overall smoothness
of your cake I'm gonna take those
confetti sprinkles or any sprinkles you
like and while the buttercream frosting
still wet so don't leave that to sit for
too long with that for us to he'll form
a little crust I'm just using my hands
to kind of roughly shove some sprinkles
just on the bottom inch inch-and-a-half
of that cake give your board a little
bit of a tidy up because you can have
sprinkles absolutely everywhere and then
from a bit of a height you just want to
scatter just a few so don't go too crazy
on the sprinkles here you really just
want to do like a little smattering of
sprinkles on top I broke those up with
some mini M&Ms because they kind of look
like bigger sprinkles and give it a
really cartoony effect and then you want
to take your straw and I'm going to
shove it through the bottom point of the
ice cream cone that I'm using so this is
going to kind of make that ice cream
cone look like it's standing up three
dimensionally on the cake I'm going to
stop the ice cream cone full of M&Ms
because I'm a bit of a chocoholic and I
love it when there's a surprise inside
something and then I'm going to stick in
marshmallow straight down on top so the
marshmallow is going to help give you
like the little ice cream top look and
it's also going to help to hold the M&Ms
in place and hold the straw in place I
put some of my buttercream frosting into
a ziploc bag and then you just want to
snip off a medium-sized tip and you're
going to fashion that into a bit of a
makeshift piping bag come around the
outside of your ice cream cone and make
like a rough ice cream style swirl so
you've kind of got an ice cream that's
not really an ice cream then you want
your little alternate sprinkles and I
thought this looked better if they
weren't the same as all the other
sprinkles sprinkle those on top of the
frosting and then add either a red M&M
or I'm using a red Jaffa you can take
that whole ice cream now and stick it
about 3/4 of the way straight down to
the centre of the cake but when you get
to that last like little bit just use
your scissors to push it down because if
you try to push it in with your fingers
your risk busting your marshmallow up
through your nice little ice cream top
you can use whatever candies you like
here I'm going to put a round rainbow
lollipop sort of on a jaunty angle off
to one side of my little ice cream and
then I also took a couple of little
liquorice allsorts I love these because
they're bright and colorful and I used a
little bit of frosting stuck on the
liquorice allsort to just
take another one slightly on top so
they're standing up and it gives it a
little bit more height that is a really
easy way to make a birthday cake that
looks anything but easy so it's still
going to have that wow factor but it
really hasn't taken us that long to put
together I hope you guys have enjoyed
this video if you want to see more from
me make sure you visit my cupcake
addiction and subscribe and as always
thanks very much for watching
